document_data.mainbody:
Golden battan were a type of freshwater fish found in the western tributaries of Al-Adib River in west Zakhara.
Golden battan had gold-colored scales and rounded snouts.
Considered a delicacy by the locals, golden battans were extremely easy to catch. Fishermen simply sprinkled bread crumbs or ground corn onto the surface of the water. The golden battan were lured to the surface and ate the bait, waiting patiently for more food at the waters surface with their snouts poking through the water where they could be caught by hand.
